course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Community Services Project: Underwater Robot Community Engagement Project
course.description: This Project course gives HKUST undergraduate students the opportunity to work in teams from different schools, to serve identified community group (i.e. primary and secondary school students/South Asian youths etc.), to understand limitations on the served groups and to learn how to apply theoretical knowledge on the building of under-water robots. Throughout the project, HKUST undergraduate students will act as teachers by transferring their skills of under-water robot building to primary and secondary school students and/or South Asian youths. HKUST undergraduate students will also learn the skills of event management throughout the project. Students must obtain prior approval from course coordinator for enrolling in the course. May be repeated for credits, if different topics are taken. Graded P or F. May be graded PP.

reviews.author: chamber
reviews.comment_content:
an engine-theme event day would be held in late April. As Tim Woo need helpers, he provides this course every spring sem

around 5 to 6 group a class, 3 to 4 ppl per group

1 group design a ppt and teach(Cantonese) the primary sch students some science knowledge(buoyancy, power, waterproof, centre of gravity) in a lecture hall (total 6 session, 30 to 45 mins per session), i am the one who deal with this part in this course, so i am quite familiar.

other groups have to design a mini game(1 group 1 game) for the primary students to play(i am not familiar with this part)

/\
|
L___ those are the "final proj" parts, except them, we need to attend the tutorials to learn some teaching skills for teaching the students. Eventually, u have to write a self-reflect report(easy task)

This course is not suggested to everyone, unless u would like to be a primary school teachers
reviews.comment_grading: no need to worry about this

not too much workload
*attend few tutorials(Sat)
*spend totally 5 to 6 hours for preparing the final proj
*1 hour self-reflect
